rights_of_access.description: Any person has a right to inspect, and at his or her discretion, to copy any public record of a public body, except as otherwise expressly provided by exemptions
rights_of_access.conditions: Subject to reasonable rules concerning time and place of access
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Public bodies must issue rules after notice and comment concerning time and place of access
rights_of_access.request_tips: No need to state purpose or show residency. Simply request to inspect and/or copy records.

rights_of_access.description: Public body shall provide the record in any form or format requested by the person
rights_of_access.conditions: Person must pay costs of reproducing the record in that form or format
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Agencies must provide records in requesters preferred format if readily reproducible
rights_of_access.request_tips: Specify your preferred format in the request (PDF, Excel, CSV, paper, etc.). Agency must comply if technically feasible.

rights_of_access.description: Public body shall make reasonable efforts to search for records in electronic form or format
rights_of_access.conditions: Except when such efforts would significantly interfere with operation of the public body's automated information system
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Agencies must search electronic systems unless it would significantly interfere with operations
rights_of_access.request_tips: Request electronic searches. Agency must justify if they refuse due to system interference.

rights_of_access.description: Records produced or collected pursuant to a contract with a private contractor to perform a public function shall be made available for inspection and copying
rights_of_access.conditions: Public body with programmatic responsibility for contractor must make records available
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Contractor records are treated same as if maintained by the public body itself
rights_of_access.request_tips: You can request records from private contractors performing public functions. Direct request to the agency with programmatic responsibility.

rights_of_access.description: Documents may be furnished without charge or at reduced charge where public body determines that waiver or reduction is in the public interest because furnishing the information can be considered as primarily benefiting the general public
rights_of_access.conditions: Must demonstrate public interest benefit
rights_of_access.applies_to: All requesters, particularly journalists, researchers, and public interest advocates
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Fee waivers discretionary based on public interest determination
rights_of_access.request_tips: Request fee waiver and explain how disclosure serves public interest, not just private interest.

rights_of_access.description: Fee schedules distinguish between commercial use, educational/noncommercial scientific use, news media, and all other requests. Review costs shall not be charged except for commercial use requests.
rights_of_access.conditions: Different fee structures apply based on requester type and use
rights_of_access.applies_to: Educational institutions, news media, non-commercial requesters
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Review costs (legal analysis of exemptions) cannot be charged to non-commercial requesters
rights_of_access.request_tips: Identify yourself as news media, educational, or non-commercial requester to avoid review charges.

rights_of_access.description: No public body shall require advance payment of any fee unless the requester has previously failed to pay fees properly charged, or the public body has determined that the fee will exceed $250
rights_of_access.conditions: Advance payment only if: (1) requester previously failed to pay, or (2) fee exceeds $250
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Agencies cannot demand upfront payment for fees under $250 from requesters in good standing
rights_of_access.request_tips: You cannot be required to pay in advance unless you previously failed to pay or the estimated fee exceeds $250.

rights_of_access.description: Public body shall make a public record accessible for inspection and copying within 15 business days after a person requests the record, or shall notify the person of its determination not to disclose
rights_of_access.conditions: 15 business days exclude Saturdays, Sundays, and legal public holidays. Body-worn camera recordings: 25 business days.
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Failure to respond within deadline is deemed denial, allowing immediate appeal
rights_of_access.request_tips: Track response deadline from date request received. If no response within 15 business days, you can immediately appeal.

rights_of_access.description: Time limit may be extended up to 10 business days for unusual circumstances: (1) searching/collecting from separate facilities, (2) voluminous records, (3) consultation with another public body
rights_of_access.conditions: Extensions only for enumerated unusual circumstances. Body-worn camera: additional 15 days if redaction vendor unavailable.
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Agency must notify you of extension and cite specific reason from statute
rights_of_access.request_tips: Extensions limited to specific circumstances. Agency must explain which circumstance applies.

rights_of_access.description: Failure to respond to a request within time limits shall be deemed a denial of the request
rights_of_access.conditions: Applies after expiration of initial deadline plus any valid extension
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: No response = automatic denial. Requester may proceed directly to administrative appeal
rights_of_access.request_tips: If agency doesn't respond within deadline, treat as denial and file immediate administrative appeal.

rights_of_access.description: Any reasonably segregable portion of a public record shall be provided after deletion of exempt portions
rights_of_access.conditions: Extent of deletion shall be indicated unless that indication would harm protected interest
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Agencies cannot withhold entire document if only part is exempt. Must redact and release.
rights_of_access.request_tips: If agency withholds entire document, challenge and demand segregable portions be released with redactions.

rights_of_access.description: Nothing in exemptions section authorizes public body to deny access when, in the public body's discretion, the public interest in disclosure outweighs considerations underlying the exemption
rights_of_access.conditions: Agency retains discretion to release even exempt records when public interest favors disclosure
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Exemptions are discretionary, not mandatory. Agencies can release if public interest outweighs harm.
rights_of_access.request_tips: Even if exemption applies, argue that public interest in disclosure outweighs the exemption.

rights_of_access.description: Provisions shall be construed liberally in favor of disclosure. In case of doubt, a record shall be disclosed unless an exemption clearly applies
rights_of_access.conditions: Applies to interpretation of entire FOIA statute
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Ambiguity or doubt resolved in favor of disclosure, not withholding
rights_of_access.request_tips: Cite this provision when agency claims ambiguous exemption. Doubt favors disclosure.

rights_of_access.subcategory: Direct Judicial Review for Council Records
rights_of_access.description: Person denied access to records in possession of the Council may institute proceedings for injunctive or declaratory relief in Superior Court without first petitioning the Mayor
rights_of_access.conditions: Applies only to Council records
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Skip administrative appeal for Council records - go straight to court
rights_of_access.request_tips: For Council records denials, you can bypass Mayor's administrative appeal and go directly to Superior Court.

rights_of_access.subcategory: Direct Judicial Review for Attorney General Records
rights_of_access.description: Person denied access to records in possession of the Office of the Attorney General may institute proceedings for injunctive or declaratory relief in Superior Court without first petitioning the Mayor
rights_of_access.conditions: Applies only to Office of Attorney General records
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Skip administrative appeal for OAG records - go straight to court
rights_of_access.request_tips: For Attorney General records denials, bypass Mayor's administrative appeal and go directly to Superior Court.

rights_of_access.description: Mayor shall make written determination on appeal petition within 10 business days (excluding Saturdays, Sundays, and legal public holidays) after receiving petition
rights_of_access.conditions: Applies to most agencies (not Council or OAG). Failure to respond in 10 days allows judicial review.
rights_of_access.applies_to: Requesters denied access to agency records
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Quick administrative review. If Mayor doesn't respond in 10 days, proceed to court.
rights_of_access.request_tips: File administrative appeal with Mayor within reasonable time. If no response in 10 business days, go to court.

rights_of_access.description: In any proceedings, the burden shall be on the public body to sustain its action. Court shall determine matter de novo and may examine records in camera.
rights_of_access.conditions: Applies in all judicial proceedings under FOIA
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Agency must prove exemption applies. You don't have to prove records should be disclosed.
rights_of_access.request_tips: In court, agency has burden to justify withholding. Judge reviews records privately (in camera) if needed.

rights_of_access.description: If court determines public body improperly withheld records, court may award reasonable attorney fees and other litigation costs to person who instituted proceedings if that person has substantially prevailed
rights_of_access.conditions: Must substantially prevail in litigation
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Fee-shifting provision encourages enforcement. Covers attorney fees and other reasonable costs.
rights_of_access.request_tips: If you win in court (even partially), request attorney fees and litigation costs.

rights_of_access.description: Arbitrary or capricious withholding of public records by a public official is a misdemeanor punishable by fine of not more than $100 for each violation
rights_of_access.conditions: Withholding must be arbitrary or capricious
rights_of_access.applies_to: Enforcement mechanism available to all requesters
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Prosecution brought by Attorney General in Superior Court
rights_of_access.request_tips: Report arbitrary withholding to DC Attorney General for potential criminal prosecution.

rights_of_access.description: Public bodies shall maintain and make available current indexes providing identifying information for public records
rights_of_access.conditions: Applies to all public bodies
rights_of_access.applies_to: All persons seeking to identify records
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Indexes must be current and accessible to help identify relevant records
rights_of_access.request_tips: Request agency's record index to identify specific records before filing FOIA request.
